title: Is LoL genuinely fun in games that end in a 20 minute surrender?

replies.body:
I can say that it is sometimes fun and not for some games that end during 20 minutes.

For losing, it's when our team members have had enough for playing it, arguments and probably toxicity that comes around from the team environment, the individual player has had enough and does not want to play with his team anymore that's what I get through my games from Aram, ranked and normals.

For winning, it's those smiling moments right? When your team knows that they have the lead its genuinely all smiles knowing that the game will be surrendered by the enemy team. It's for certain positive but it can drag the fun away since you wanted to do more in game.


From the games that I am experiencing now there are less players that are not surrendering as much, less pessimistic players are nice and its good to see optimistic team mates of mine not giving up and strive to keep winning through the outcomes of the game.

:)
